H0.text: What is the name of a device, consisting essentially of two wires of different metals, whereby heat energy may be changed to electrical energy. Thermocouple

H1.text: What is the name of a device, consisting essentially of two wires of different metals, whereby heat energy may be changed to electrical energy. Thermistor

H2.text: What is the name of a device, consisting essentially of two wires of different metals, whereby heat energy may be changed to electrical energy. Pyroelectric

H3.text: What is the name of a device, consisting essentially of two wires of different metals, whereby heat energy may be changed to electrical energy. Thermel

A4.text: A thermocouple, also known as a thermoelectrical thermometer, is an electrical device consisting of two dissimilar electrical conductors forming an electrical junction.
